sub_topic: Determine the geodesics on a given surface.
message_1: A sphere with radius 2 units has a point A located on the equator at longitude 0 and another point B located on the equator at longitude 90 degrees. Determine the shortest distance, in units, between point A and point B along the surface of the sphere.
message_2:
To find the shortest distance between point A and point B along the surface of the sphere, we can use the arc length formula for a circle. Since both points are on the equator, they lie on a great circle (a circle with the same diameter as the sphere).

The formula for the arc length of a circle is:

Arc length = radius × angle (in radians)

The angle between the two points is 90 degrees, which is equivalent to π/2 radians.

The radius of the sphere is given as 2 units.

So, the arc length (shortest distance) between point A and point B is:

Arc length = 2 × (π/2) = π units
